events.title: Mutiny on the Bounty
events.description: The HMS Bounty, under the command of Lieutenant William Bligh, faced a famous mutiny led by Masters' Mate Fletcher Christian in the South Pacific.
events.significance: This event became one of the most well-known mutinies in naval history and has been widely depicted in literature and film.

events.title: The First Groundbreaking of the Suez Canal
events.description: Construction began on the Suez Canal, which would connect the Mediterranean Sea to the Red Sea, significantly impacting global maritime trade routes.
events.significance: The canal revolutionized international shipping by drastically reducing travel distance between Europe and Asia.

events.title: Gallipoli Campaign Commences in World War I
events.description: Allied forces began the Gallipoli Campaign with landings on the Gallipoli peninsula in Turkey, aiming to secure a sea route to Russia.
events.significance: Despite being a significant military operation, it ended in heavy losses and withdrawal, shaping national identities, especially in Australia and New Zealand (ANZAC Day).

events.title: Liberation of Italy's Capital Rome
events.description: Allied forces liberated Rome from Nazi occupation during World War II.
events.significance: This was the first Axis capital to fall to the Allies, marking a major turning point in the Italian Campaign.

events.title: Carnation Revolution in Portugal
events.description: A nearly bloodless military coup in Portugal led to the overthrow of the Estado Novo dictatorship, initiating a transition to democracy.
events.significance: This event ended decades of authoritarian rule and prompted decolonization in Portuguese colonies.
